prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "'This Ain’t It, Chief' Updated To 'This Ain’t It, Noble Indigenous Tribal Leader'". Use it as a reference: U.S. - The popular internet comment response "This ain't it, chief," has been rightfully seen by many as problematic for years as it appropriates Native American culture in a derisive way, using the word "chief," which everybody knows is an offensive term. Native Americans have spent countless hours weeping since it was first coined.New Internet guidelines state that people must now say, "This ain't it, noble indigenous tribal leader." Leading social media platforms have already begun to implement an algorithm that automatically corrects the text any time a user types in the dated phrase. Experts say this will solve racism.The decision was arrived at after a recent Twitter user responded to a problematic tweet by saying, "this ain't it, chief" which led to another user responding, "This ain't it, CHIEF?! THIS ain't it, ch-- ch--" causing the software to meltdown, resulting in a momentary Twitter outage.Those who attempt to use the phrase in its out-dated format will be flagged and visited by the authorities.

candidate: Experts say that racism and discrimination can be solved with the newest update on the internet. The popularized phrase "This ain't it, chief," has been replaced with "This ain't it, noble indigenous tribal leader" to avoid any further appropriation of Native American culture and to erase any derogatory or offensive references to their community. It comes after a series of events sparked the need for this update, starting with a Twitter user responding to a prejudiced tweet with the old comment format, and another user correcting them by emphasizing the offensive phrase "chief". This sequence of events drove the need for the new internet guidelines, and led to an automatic correction of the phrase, flagged to everyone who tries to use the old, problematic comment. If people attempt to use the outdated phrase, they will be visited by the authorities and held accountable for their actions, or at the very least, flagged on whichever social media platform they are using.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Using Our Prophetic Powers For Good: The Babylon Bee Will Now Only Write Articles About Positive Things Happening To Humanity". Use it as a reference: U.S. - Over the past few years, we have noticed a disturbing trend in our satire: it comes true. In the beginning, we thought it was just coincidence, but as the fulfilled prophecies continued to stack up, we came to accept the truth. We here at the Babylon Bee have been given the gift of prophetic vision, and it's time to use that spiritual gift for the good of mankind.It has therefore been decided that we will only make jokes about cool and good things so our future will be cool and good. Here are some of our headlines. Enjoy your new future!We have more, but that's probably enough goodness for now. We don't want to overdo it. You're welcome, world!

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Study Finds Connection Between Wearing A Mask And Being A Big Sissy". Use it as a reference: U.S. - Studies have shown that wearing masks can help slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, but a new alarming study shows that wearing a mask has a downside: It greatly increases your chance of being a big sissy."The results are incredible," said sissiness researcher Winston Sullivan. "Someone could seem perfectly normal, but as soon as they put on a mask, you're all, 'Aww. Is the poor little guy scared of getting the flu?' Total wussification, as it's known in my field."According to the study, when some of the participants wore masks, Sullivan felt compelled to knock them to the ground and shout names at them. "And all they did in response," Sullivan explained, "was say, 'Is this part of the experiment?' What a bunch of dorks."Sullivan did say that in certain situations wearing a mask could not make you a sissy, such as if it were "part of an entire ninja ensemble." "But if you don't know kung fu," Sullivan said, "it definitely just makes you a big sissy."Sullivan did admit the masks were somewhat effective in keeping people from "infecting each other with the 'rona and dying and stuff," which is worth noting if "you're the sort of nerd who cares about that."

candidate: Study Finds Connection Between Wearing A Mask And Being A Big SissyLos Angeles, CA - Studies have shown that wearing masks can help slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, but a new alarming study shows that wearing a mask has a downside: It greatly increases your chance of being a big sissy."The results are incredible," said sissiness researcher Winston Sullivan. "Someone could seem perfectly normal, but as soon as they put on a mask, you're all, 'Aww. Is the poor little guy scared of getting the flu?' Total wussification, as it's known in my field."According to the study, when some of the participants wore masks, Sullivan felt compelled to knock them to the ground and shout names at them. "And all they did in response," Sullivan explained, "was say, 'Is this part of the experiment?' What a bunch of dorks."Sullivan did say that in certain situations wearing a mask could not make you a sissy, such as if it were "part of an entire ninja ensemble." "But if you don't know kung fu," Sullivan said, "it definitely just makes you a big sissy."Sullivan did admit the masks were somewhat effective in keeping people from "infecting each other with the 'rona and dying and stuff," which is worth noting if "you're the sort of nerd who cares about that." "But really, this new scientific study shows that people who wear masks are just big babies," Sullivan said. "And if you are one of those people, consider this: Real men don't wear masks. But they do wash their hands regularly. Sometimes for hours at a time." Sullivan plans to continue his research on this topic and will likely not be covering his face anytime soon.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Benny Hinn Travels To Dagobah To Master His Power To Knock People Over". Use it as a reference: DAGOBAH, OUTER RIM - Benny Hinn is one of the best-known miraculous healers in the galaxy. His powers are formidable -- but he hasn't yet completed his training. So, Hinn got in his private jet and flew to Dagobah to complete his training in the ways of the Force with Jedi Master Yoda."Reach your hand out you must and knock over that stump," said Yoda."I will try," Hinn replied."Do, or do not. There is no try.""Well, I mean, I'm just going to declare victory over it," Hinn explained."That is why you fail," Yoda replied.Yoda set up various training courses in the swamps of Dagobah, from training dummies Hinn would have to try to pickpocket to a whole line of dummies he would have to knock over with his mind.In one horrible training session, Hinn went into a dark cave and was confronted by John MacArthur. "NOOOOO!!!!" Hinn screamed, running for his life after he was unable to knock MacArthur down with his Force powers.Yoda shook his head and smacked Hinn with his cane. "Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. I sense much fear in you.""Well, that all sounds pretty bad. But will I make a lot of money?""Oh, yeah, for sure," Yoda said."OK, cool," Hinn replied before pulling his private jet out of the swamp with his mind and flying back to his home planet.

candidate: Sure! Here is an article based on the instructions provided:## Benny Hinn Travels To Dagobah To Master His Power To Knock People OverDAGOBAH, OUTER RIM -Famed miraculous healer and evangelist Benny Hinn has taken his unique brand of "healing" to the swamps of Dagobah in search of further enlightenment and power. Recognized as one of the galaxy's most prominent practitioners of supernatural healing, Hinn hopes to enhance his abilities through training with the one and only Jedi Master Yoda.Upon arrival, Hinn is instructed by the wise and ancient Yoda to practice his power of knocking people over with the Force. However, Hinn's approach of simply declaring victories without genuine effort earns him a scolding from the Jedi Master. Yoda emphasizes the importance of focusing on the task at hand and avoiding the path of the dark side, namely the desire for personal financial gain that has driven Hinn's "healing" practices.Hinn's training proves challenging as he faces numerous tests, including wielding his telekinetic powers to maneuver training dummies and navigating dark caves where he encounters figures of faith he is unable to overcome, such as John MacArthur. Yoda's guidance leads Hinn to confront his fears and the potential dangers of exploiting faith for personal profit.Despite the arduous training and confronting his fears, Hinn remains confident that his enhanced abilities will bring him greater financial success, a notion that Yoda cautiously acknowledges. Hinn departs Dagobah in his private jet, eager to implement his newfound insights and continue his healing endeavors, albeit with a greater understanding of the balance between power, fear, and personal gain.It is important to note that this article is a work of satire, and while it pokes fun at certain aspects of religion and pop culture, it is intended to entertain and provoke thought through its imaginative storyline.

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "White House Adds Cry Room For Fussy Reporters". Use it as a reference: WASHINGTON, D.C. - The Trump White House has added a new feature to the James S. Brady Press Briefing Room: a separate cry room for fussy reporters who are crying during press briefings and interrupting the proceedings.The quiet, serene room will allow news agencies to take their crying, wailing, fussy reporters into a separate space to calm them down so the press briefings can continue without interruption."If you notice one of your reporters starting to tear up, just take them into the cry room and soothe them before joining us again," said Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany. "There are pictures of Obama, bottles of kombucha, and some Tickle-You-Biden plushies in there to keep them occupied and help them feel safe.""Hey, wait a minute! Are you saying we're babies!?" shouted one reporter, tears welling up in his eyes."Well, yes," McEnany replied."That's... that's mean!" His lip began to quiver and he was forced to excuse himself to the cry room."WAAAAHHH!!!" cried Jim Acosta. "ORANGE MAN BAD! ORANGE MAN BAD!" One of his fellow CNN reporters cradled him in her arms and took him out into the cry room with an apologetic look on her face.The cry room may need expanding soon, however, since every single reporter except OANN's Chanel Rion was sent to the cry room during the first press briefing. Rion pointed and laughed at them as they went into the cry room, calling them "dumb babies," which made them cry harder.

"If you're gonna pretend to be Joe Biden, you have to add in several rambling asides, some made-up words, and three or four major gaffes. It clearly wasn't him, so we took steps to lock down his account.""Hackers, you know, thhhhe--the thing that, that hacks--hackers are dangerous," said Joe Biden in a statement to the press. "Back in my day, hackers were the guys who would cut down your telegram wire and listen in on the ol' party line. My cousin, Velma, she once said..." At this point, he abruptly fell asleep.Meanwhile, President Trump's account posted several deranged rants about random stuff, assuring everyone that his account had not been compromised.

candidate: "Hack Suspected As Biden Posts Complete Thought On Twitter" For those who have long-followed the illustrious career of Joe Biden, this week brought a shocking development in the world of politics and all-things-internet: the vice president posted a coherent thought on Twitter. And not just any coherent thought, but a thoughtfully constructed argument, complete with punctuation and capitalization (!). According to sources close to the situation, it was this unprecedented display of clarity and cohesion in a social media posting that immediately set off alarm bells amongst Twitter IT folks, triggering a full account lockdown in less than five minutes. "It was a clear case of mistaken identity," whispered one IT technician, on the condition of anonymity, as they cleared away the remnants of Biden's now-defunct Twitter account. "The vice president's team is well-aware of the characteristics that trigger a breach of protocols: improper capitalization, excessive typos, and at least two mentions of 'malarkey'... but this tweet had none of that. It was flawless."  flawless, that is, aside from a potential case of plagiarism. Many have noted the remarkable similarities between Biden's now-famous tweet and a passage from the introduction of former President Barack Obama's 2013 State of the Union Address: "At its best, change brings out the best in us, it calls us to action, and it is born of hope. We saw that hope in the voices of the Iraqi children, who years ago, embraced me with joy and gratitude because I had come to help them build a school." While Biden's message differed in tone and delivery, the underlying meaning and sentiment remained resolutely unchanged. "It just didn't add up," continued the technician, "and we knew we had to act fast." Of course, as is customary in these situations, Biden himself had little insight to offer when questioned by the press. "Hackers, you know, thhhhe--the thing that, that hacks--hackers are dangerous," he began, before abruptly changing gears and trailing off mid-thought, visibly struggling to remember what he was supposed to say. It was in that moment, sources report, that Biden realized his Twitter account had been compromised. A closer inspection of his Twitter feed revealed a series of erratic tweets sent out in the days prior, leading many to question the vice president's mental acuity. "It's going to take a lot of explaining to do," admitted one White House staffer, "especially if he wants to get back that Twitter Blue Check Mark he worked so hard to get." Meanwhile, in a surprising show of composure and clarity, President Donald Trump swiftly took to the platform to assure all and sundry that his account had not been hacked, and that the truth was, in fact, the exact opposite. "I am telling you, it was THEM that hacked her (exaggerated air quotes), not me," he tweeted, adding a #NoCollusion hashtag for good measure. "A total setup. You think I really need to steal tweets from Sleepy Joe?? Not a chance!" The apparent double standard hasn't gone unnoticed by the public, with many alleging a clear attempt at favoritism by Twitter's algorithms and IT team. "If you're a Biden supporter," tweeted popular conservative commentator, Candace Owens, "you deserve this kind of treatment from Big Tech. They don't have any interest in fairness. Their goal is to control the narrative." At press time, Biden's team had broken their silence, issuing a short statement in response to the Twitter incident. "Joe Biden was confused," it read, "and incoherently posted to Twitter. Out of an abundance of caution, his team has temporarily suspended all activities and shut down his account until further notice." The statement was met with widespread applause online, particularly among those who had been calling for the vice president to resign, effective immediately. "Finally, some accountability," tweeted popular activist group, 'We Demand Civility And Mental Stability From Our Leaders Please,' alongside a triumphant emoji of a neatly tied shoelace. Meanwhile, Biden himself was seen asking aides if he could "get TikTok on that brand-new iPhone thingy?"

prompt: You are a satirical writer. You need to write an article with headline: "Kanye West Drops Out Of Race After Elon Musk Offers Him Position As President Of Mars". Use it as a reference: LOS ANGELES, CA - Kanye West has dropped out of the presidential race, several sources confirmed today, after Elon Musk offered to instead make him president of Mars."America is great and all, but being president of Mars would be the greatest of all time," West said. "Of all time."Musk said he had a great conversation with West where he convinced him not to aim too low but instead to "shoot for the stars.""Kanye has way more potential than just being president of America," Musk said. "Frankly, being president of the U.S. is beneath him. Mars is where it's at. It will be way better than any government on this planet."West then showed Musk his crude drawings for a rocket ship to Mars he'd designed in his spare time, called the Yeezymobile. The Yeezymobile is made of "space metal" and runs on Chick-fil-A peanut oil: a "100% environmentally friendly" design, according to West."And that big fin on the back adds at least 1,000 horsepower," West said."I love this guy's enthusiasm," said Musk as he looked over the drawing. "We'll have to make a few changes so the craft will obey the laws of physics, but this is a great start. Hey, who are those two stick figures in the front?""That's me and you, Musk. Me and you," West said, looking up at the stars and putting his arm around his entrepreneurial friend. "We are gonna be the kings of the universe, my friend. The kings of the universe."

candidate: "Kanye West Drops Out Of Race After Elon Musk Offers Him Position As President Of Mars"Have you ever seen a meme that amplifies the ridiculousness of a certain scenario, only to realize it's actually not that crazy? Well, that's kind of the situation that played out today in Los Angeles, with Kanye West dropping out of the presidential race after a proposition by Elon Musk. West declared "America is great and all, but being president of Mars would be the greatest of all time." After a conversation with Musk, it would seem this is a belief that Musk agreed with and consequently offered West the position of President of Mars.Musk stated: "Kanye has way more potential than just being president of America," Musk said. "Frankly, being president of the U.S. is beneath him. Mars is where it's at. It will be way better than any government on this planet."It seems West had already been working on a space exploration idea of his own, the "Yeezymobile" which he proudly presented to Musk. The vessel is intended to transport those eager to colonize Mars, with West declaring it would be powered by "100% environmentally friendly" Chick-fil-A peanut oil. While Musk appeared to appreciate the enthusiasm, he did mention that some changes would need to be made to ensure the craft actually complies with the laws of physics. Musk also queried who the two stick figures were intended to be, to which West replied: "That's me and you, Musk. Me and you ... We are gonna be the kings of the universe, my friend. The kings of the universe."Let's just say, if anyone can make the dream of becoming President of Mars a reality, it's probably Kanye West and Elon Musk. Perhaps this could be the start of a new and exciting partnership. If anything, we surely haven't heard the last of the Yeezymobile just yet...
